alert.note: Alert for Wetzel (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 2:58AM EDT until May 08 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Ohio, including the following counties, Monroe and Noble. Portions of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Wetzel. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 258 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated minor flooding on local streams. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.4 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodsfield, Caldwell, Dudley, Sardis, Clarington, Belle Valley, Lewisville, Dexter City, Cameron, Antioch, Stafford, Graysville, Harriettsville, Rinard Mills and Laings. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
